main event: A UFO sighting by an F102 pilot in the Puget Sound area, Washington on 9 June 1958, involving a cylindrical object with a dark center that demonstrated erratic movement before accelerating out of sight.
interesting points: The object was described as cylindrical with a dark center and appeared to hover, descend, and make erratic orbits before accelerating and climbing rapidly out of sight.
The pilot observed the object while flying at an altitude of 40,000 to 50,000 feet and estimated its speed to be 6,500 MPH.
The pilot mentioned that the object made 4 or 5 small orbits around the F-102 aircraft before rapidly climbing and disappearing on a northwestern heading.
The conclusion drawn by ATIC was that the object was probably a balloon, based on factors such as wind direction, altitude, and observed behavior of the object.
The report highlights the challenges of accurately assessing UFO sightings, especially when involving high-speed aerial phenomena and limited observational data.
photographs: no photographs included in the report
